intro: Centranthus angustifolius var. rifanus, commonly known as narrow-leaved red campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, this plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. It is often found in coastal areas and dry habitats due to its drought tolerance. The plant is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
